basics.name: Imed Kouki
basics.label: RPA Developer & Automation Consultant | Master's Thesis Researcher
basics.summary: Engineering process automation solutions using the UiPath Platform and Microsoft Power Automate. Experienced in designing and implementing automation workflows that streamline business operations. Currently a Master's Thesis Researcher working on agentic approaches for BPMN process model generation through multi-agent systems and prompt engineering.

work.name: TUI Group
highlights: Design and develop end-to-end automation workflows using UiPath Platform (Studio, Orchestrator, Document Understanding, AI Center) and MS Power Automate, integrating REST APIs, Microsoft Graph API, and Azure cloud services.
Build and maintain integrations with SharePoint, Dataverse, and external APIs using n8n and custom connectors, implementing data pipelines and document processing workflows.

Delivered and supported over 7 automation projects with focus on ALM best practices and governance, improving operational efficiency across multiple business units and achieving cumulative savings of more than 11 FTEs.
Collaborated with stakeholders to capture requirements, design technical documentation (PDDs, SDDs), and ensure alignment with process governance standards and deployment pipelines.

work.name: LARIA, ENSI (University of Manouba)
highlights: Worked on agentic systems for automated BPMN process model generation using multi-agent architectures, built with LangChain/LangGraph, focusing on schema validation, systematic prompting, and text-to-model synthesis reliability.
Conducted rapid prototyping and experimentation with n8n for pipeline orchestration, and RAG pipelines using Mistral embeddings to reduce context window dependency.
Built custom text processing workflows for chunking and cleaning data before agent execution.

Implemented web-based UI integrations using bpmn.io for BPMN visualization and interaction. Utilize LangSmith for tracing, performance insights, and benchmarking agent behaviors across Mistral models (Large/Medium) with different configurations.

work.name: ADACTIM — WEEVIO Group
highlights: Identified automation opportunities and created PDDs with BPMN diagrams for supervision processes.
Configured and deployed GLPI container using Docker and WSL2.
Developed, tested, and deployed UiPath automation workflows aligned with business requirements.

work.name: DRÄXLMAIER — Group SATS
highlights: Worked on switch configuration and Packet Tracer simulations.

education.institution: National School of Computer Science (ENSI) - University of Manouba
education.area: Master of Research in Computer Science

education.institution: Higher Institute of Technological Studies (ISET Rades / Siliana)

projects.name: Text-to-Process Model Generation
projects.description: Developing agentic approaches for BPMN process model generation using multi-agent systems built with LangChain/LangGraph and prompt engineering. Implements RAG pipelines using Mistral models (Large/Medium) and Mistral embeddings, with LangSmith for tracing and benchmarking. Features web-based UI integration using bpmn.io for process visualization.

projects.name: SVD-Based ICP Algorithm
projects.description: Implementation of the Iterative Closest Point (ICP) algorithm, used for 3D point cloud registration.
